benchmark_details.name: PromptRobust
benchmark_details.overview: PromptRobust is a robustness benchmark designed to measure LLMsâ€™ resilience to adversarial prompts across multiple levels: character, word, sentence, and semantic.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the robustness of LLMs to adversarial prompts and provide insights for better prompt composition.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark primarily evaluates robustness against adversarial prompts, not input samples.

data.source: Generated through various prompt conditions and attacks.
data.annotation: Prompts perturbed to simulate user errors and analyze responsiveness of LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Performance Drop Rate calculated based on relative performance decline post-prompt attack.
methodology.interpretation: Higher PDR indicates lower model robustness to adversarial prompts.
methodology.baseline_results: Initial performance of LLMs without prompt attacks.
methodology.validation: Comprehensive evaluation across 9 LLMs using diverse tasks and datasets.

targeted_risks.harm: Adversarial prompts may lead to incorrect outputs in critical tasks affecting user decisions.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Adversarial prompts created for testing without user data.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Adversarial prompts generated from public datasets.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Follows ethical standards in ML research.
